metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8694 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient access control in the Linux kernel driver for some Intel(R)Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-123.126
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-123.126
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-123.126
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-123.126
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-123.126
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.3.0-69-generic - 5.3.0-69.65
linux-image-5.3.0-69-lowlatency - 5.3.0-69.65

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-123.126').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-69.65').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
